text: Would sure help me out a lot. I was linked here because I was trying to find a solution to my API calls to the Associations v4 API not working in custom code actions. Turns out that that isn't supported by Client v8.

<@U05BC4T17T4> It was my EXACT issue!
Apparently it works in v10 in the custom code editor, but there are some other issues. Like you can't create associations while creating new objects..
<@U0687RD4LJW> oh, lovely. I just ended up using V3 as my use case was simple enough.

Hi Hetal

I haven't found a solution for pinning it automatically, AFAIK its not possible. However if you wanna format you should be able to use standard HTML/CSS formatting with <b> for bold, etc.
Link's I've seen done using  ![](<http://www.urllinkhere.com|www.urllinkhere.com>) inside the given note body

Good morning everyone! Does anyone have an amazing way to catalog workflows? I'm developing workflows for a nonprofit client with 3 or so major workstreams, turning each automation piece into it's own workflow for modularity but it's starting to become quite a rats nest so I'd like to find a great way to catalog and create a less complex dewey decimal system for this library of workflows. I recognize that HubSpot does provide some organization tools but I'd prefer not to use folders and I also need a way to sequence all of the different parts of the automation. Any suggestions are appreciated! Thank you.

i use naming conventions on top of folders for organization. 

example folder: intake workflows 
this is where i process new accounts / objects
objectname [step x] - description

so Patient [step 1] create associated contact 
Patient [step 2] create associated deal
patient [step 3] notifications - internal and externally
Ah this is helpful <@U25PYL3Q8>! If there's case logic for your steps, do you split that up in the naming convention somehow or do you handle that within the workflow itself?
Additionally, how do you handle versioning typically?
